criteria: Understanding of different types of harmful relationships (physical, emotional, verbal, digital)
Ability to recognize warning signs of abuse in relationships
Knowledge of resources and strategies for seeking help in abusive situations
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of harmful relationships or their various forms.
Shows a limited awareness of only one type of harmful relationship.
Recognizes two types of harmful relationships but struggles to differentiate them.
Identifies and differentiates between three types of harmful relationships.
Clearly identifies and explains four types of harmful relationships, providing examples.
Comprehensively explains various types of harmful relationships (physical, emotional, verbal, digital), providing detailed examples and demonstrating a nuanced understanding.
Unable to identify any warning signs of abuse in relationships.
Identifies one or two vague signs of potential abuse.
Recognizes a few general warning signs but cannot apply them to specific scenarios.
Identifies several common warning signs of abuse and can relate them to possible situations.
Accurately recognizes and explains multiple warning signs of abuse, demonstrating an understanding of their implications.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of subtle and overt warning signs of abuse, providing insightful analysis of their potential impact and escalation.
Is unaware of any resources or strategies for seeking help.
Names one possible resource but lacks specific details.
Identifies a couple of resources but doesn't explain how to access or utilize them effectively.
Knows several resources and can generally explain how to seek help.
Clearly articulates multiple resources and outlines practical strategies for seeking help in abusive situations.
Demonstrates comprehensive knowledge of diverse resources and develops detailed, personalized strategies for seeking help, considering various factors (e.g., safety, confidentiality).
